source.title: Using the REST API - Vercel API Docs
source.description: Vercel REST API fundamentals covering HTTP/TLS server specs, JSON content-type requirements, bearer token authentication with access token creation and team scope, data types (ID, String, Integer, Float, Map, List, Enum, Date, IsoDate, Boolean), pagination with timestamp-based cursors, rate limits with headers, and endpoint versioning.

source.title: Integrations - Vercel API Docs
source.description: Integration management example demonstrating the Vercel SDK usage to list account integrations with the `getConfigurations` method, displaying integration slugs, installation types, and associated projects using bearer token authentication.

source.title: Vercel Hobby Plan
source.description: Vercel Hobby plan free tier limits (Edge Config reads/writes, CPU hours, provisioned memory, function invocations/duration, image optimisation, Speed Insights, Web Analytics), 30-day non-commercial billing, fair use restrictions, and Pro comparison.

source.title: AI SDK
source.description: Vercel AI SDK TypeScript toolkit overview covering AI SDK Core's unified API for text generation across providers (OpenAI, Anthropic), structured data generation with `generateObject` and `streamObject` using Zod schemas, tool calling integration for external systems, framework support (Next.js, Vue, Svelte, Node.js), and installation guide.

source.title: Vercel Pro Plan
source.description: Vercel Pro plan pricing covering $20/month platform fee with included deploying seat and monthly credit, credit-based billing for infrastructure resources (1TB Fast Data Transfer, 10M Edge Requests included), team seats (paid Owner/Member at $20/month, unlimited free Viewer seats), paid add-ons (SAML SSO, HIPAA BAA, Flags Explorer, Observability Plus), spend management, and Hobby downgrade process.

source.title: Spend Management
source.description: Vercel spend management for Pro plans covering spend amount configuration per billing cycle, automatic actions (notifications at 50%/75%/100%, webhook triggers, production deployment pausing), metered resource coverage, alert threshold notifications (web, email, SMS), project pausing/unpausing procedures, webhook payload structures, and activity logging.
